hypothesis_content.title: Overnight Asian Session Liquidity Gap Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL/BEAR regimes, when BTC price moves >1.5% during low-liquidity Asian session (00:00-08:00 UTC) without corresponding moves in S&P futures or DXY, fading that move at London open (08:00 UTC) yields positive expectancy with reversal to pre-move levels within 4 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Asian session moves without macro correlation or volume support are often liquidity-driven and get reversed when European liquidity enters. In neutral/bear regimes, there's less conviction to sustain directional moves without fundamental drivers.
entry_conditions: BTC price move |1.5%| during 00:00-08:00 UTC window
S&P futures and DXY moves during same window < |0.3%|
BTC 1H volume during move < 65% of 20-day same-hour average
Enter counter-trend at 08:00 UTC candle open

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Move extends additional 1% in same direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If Asian session moves without macro correlation continue in same direction through London session >55% of time, indicating structural change in market participation patterns.
